image.altText: A mussel with red tendrils on a coconut fibre mat

props.synopsis: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

title.children: South Australia plans mussel recovery after algal bloom crisis

image.altText: A group of March for Australia protesters waving Australian and Eureka Stockade flags

props.synopsis: Demonstrators gathered in cities across the country today, with March for Australia rallies sparking counter protests. Follow live.

title.children: Anti-immigration rallies and counter protests held across the country with lower numbers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Former Adelaide March For Australia organiser switches side to Rally Against Racism
WATCH: Riot police move in on Melbourne protest
Protesters clash at Canberra's Commonwealth Bridge

image.altText: A golf course with lots of trees along the side and a city in the background

props.synopsis: As the Malinauskas government proceeds with its $50 million North Adelaide golf course upgrade, some Kaurna elders are grappling with the prospect that the redevelopment could uncover Aboriginal remains.

title.children: Future LIV Golf site decision sparks mixed reaction from Kaurna community

image.altText: Claire Jackson takes a selfie with son Brodie

props.synopsis: After a traumatic birth, followed by mental and physical health challenges, Claire was "one and done". But divorce made her think twice about her decision.

title.children: How Claire's decision to be 'one and done' was rocked by divorce

image.altText: Wheels and debris in bushland.

props.synopsis: A memorial, including a replica of the aircraft and a plaque made out of a stone recovered from the crash site, has been unveiled in York.

title.children: Australia's worst peacetime aviation disaster remembered 75 years later

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne and Mitch Swepson celebrate

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne's magical early season form continues with the bat, Scott Boland and a pair of spinners offer a reminder of their skill, while Sam Konstas turns on the flair at round two of the Sheffield Shield.

title.children: Quick hits: Send-offs, spinners and more Marnus magic in the Shield

image.altText: A silhoutte of working dogs on a quad bike.

props.synopsis: Hot nights coupled with high daytime temperatures could see Australia heading into an extremely hot summer, BOM's first long-range forecast indicates.

title.children: Hot summer on the cards as BOM gives first sneak peek into season

image.altText: Outback South Australia during the search for Gus.

props.synopsis: When police announced a new search for a missing four-year-old earlier this week, it came with a renewed hope for answers. But the latest search came to an end on Friday with crews finding no sign of little Gus.

title.children: Renewed search for Gus concludes without answers

image.altText: Soccer player Nestory Irankunda at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Are A-League soccer fans right to be frustrated when its best young players are sold off, or should they accept it is a 'selling' league?

title.children: Is the transfer of Australia's best young soccer players a good thing?

image.altText: A group of soccer players in red celebrate a goal by jumping on each other.

props.synopsis: Adelaide United begins its season with a 2-1 win over Sydney, while Brisbane coach Michael Valkanis sees son Dimitri sent off in the Roar's 1-0 defeat of Macarthur.

title.children: Adelaide downs Sydney as Roar coach sees son sent off on A-League opening night

image.altText: Indy Tahau of the Power marks in front of Jenna Richardson of the Hawks

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide defeats Hawthorn to record its fourth win of the AFLW season, while West Coast moves closer to a maiden finals appearance with victory over Geelong.

title.children: Tahau kicks five goals as Port powers past Hawks, Eagles soar closer to finals

image.altText: A young woman with long, curly, brown hair sits on a couch. She wears a white blouse with black polka dots and ruffled sleeves.

props.synopsis: Chronic pain affects one in five Australian children. Two young people who experience it want more people to understand their conditions and better support for all children in pain.

title.children: 'I may have arthritis but I am not old': Growing up with chronic pain

image.altText: Two flags on a golf course with large buildings from the city in the background.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Aboriginal Affairs minister has imposed 31 strict conditions on the government's planned redevelopment of the North Adelaide golf course.

title.children: Strict conditions imposed on future LIV Golf site

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coroner has recommended changes to national driving fitness standards following the death of cyclist Robert Hill who was hit and killed by a partially blind driver on a country highway seven years ago.

title.children: Inquest recommends reforms after cyclist killed by partially blind driver

image.altText: The top of a swing pole showing a hole where a bolt should be

props.synopsis: South Australia's Education Department has been fined $225,000 after a student at a special school fell from a swing which had not had a comprehensive safety inspection for eight years.

title.children: Teen's playground fall costs department $225K fine for failed inspections

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt runs up to kick a goat kid

props.synopsis: Jet Jai Johnson is released from prison two-and-a-half months into his 14-month sentence after telling a court spending his 21st birthday behind bars was a wake-up call.

title.children: Animal cruelty offender released after 'wake-up call' 21st behind bars

image.altText: a road sign with clouds and trees in the background

props.synopsis: The South Australian ombudsman says Southern Mallee Council Mayor Ron Valentine improperly used his position to gain an advantage for himself in the recruitment of a CEO in 2023.

title.children: Council mayor apologises for misconduct in CEO recruitment process

image.altText: A man in military uniform, aiming a weapon, seen from side on.

props.synopsis: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

title.children: Finland has a message for Vladimir Putin: We're ready

image.altText: A large concrete sign with letters saying National Gallery of Australia.

props.synopsis: The National Gallery will host an exhibition of art from the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands three years after a video appearing to show a non-Aboriginal assistant helping to paint an artwork led to it being postponed.

title.children: National Gallery to host postponed APY artists exhibition after three years

image.altText: A moddy picture of a Broken Hill streetscape

props.synopsis: In October 2024, thousands of households and businesses in far west NSW were hit by a catastrophic power outage that lasted for weeks, and the fallout continues.

title.children: Outback communities reflect on actions taken one year on from power outages

image.altText: a blurred photo of a six-year-old boy with a shaved head

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has pleaded guilty to 11 charges after she faked her six-year-old son's cancer diagnosis in a bid to raise more than $11,000.

title.children: Mother who faked son's cancer diagnosis pleads guilty to 11 charges

image.altText: The top of a police car with the word 'Police' on it. Some city buildings are in the background

props.synopsis: A man has been restrained by passengers on a full bus during peak hour in Adelaide's north-east after allegedly being "aggressive and abusive", a witness says.

title.children: 'Aggressive' man restrained during peak hour bus ride, passenger claims

image.altText: Screenshot of Elle Barker's video talking to her followers.

props.synopsis: A South Australian influencer has used her TikTok to warn others to be careful about sharing personal information in public, after a stranger memorised her phone number while she recited it to a cashier.

title.children: Influencer issues warning after stranger memorises phone number at check-out

image.altText: A white building with green signs across the roof line which read: Ultra Tune and Auto Service Centre

props.synopsis: An Ultra Tune franchisee who left two apprentices unsupervised while he holidayed interstate has been indefinitely prohibited from having trainees over supervision concerns.

title.children: Franchisee's holiday leads to trainee ban amid safety concerns

image.altText: Tourists sleep with their heads on a small table inside a McDonald's outlet.

props.synopsis: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

title.children: Chinese tourists sleep in fast food outlet to save on accommodation

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: As other world leaders have discovered, a visit to Donald Trump's White House can become an unpredictable, if not uncomfortable, encounter.

title.children: The PM is set to sit down with Trump. What can he learn from other leaders?

image.altText: ange postecoglou waves his hands in the air wearing a nottingham forest jacket

props.synopsis: Nottingham Forest sacked the winless manager moments after their 3-0 defeat by Chelsea on Saturday local time, which left the club 17th in the standings and on the brink of slipping into the relegation zone.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou sacked by Nottingham Forest after eight games

image.altText: Steve Waugh smiles, sitting in a room with lots of windows behind him.

props.synopsis: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

title.children: The powerful encounter that set Steve Waugh on a path to philanthropy

image.altText: Oscar Piastri crashes into Lando Norris

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have once again made contact with each other in a Formula 1 race, this time taking each other out at the sprint race of the US Grand Prix, just two weeks after their collision in Singapore.

title.children: 'It was more on Oscar': Sprint crash adds another twist to F1 title race

image.altText: Jamie Melham holds aloft the Caulfield Cup after riding Half Yours to victory.

props.synopsis: Jamie Melham breaks new ground as the first female jockey to win the Caulfield Cup in its 149-year history, steering favourite Half Yours to victory in the $5 million handicap.

title.children: Melham creates Caulfield Cup history after riding Half Yours to victory

image.altText: Snake bite victim Tristian Frahm holding a puppy

props.synopsis: The death of an 11-year-old Queensland boy from a snakebite may have been prevented had he received early medical attention, according to the findings of an inquest.

title.children: Coroner finds snakebite death of 11yo boy preventable

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Hard Quiz Kids is here again, and we're gifting you a bunch of straightforward questions. Don't embarrass yourself.

title.children: Put your thinking cap on. It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: A man in a cape

props.synopsis: The third-born child of Queen Elizabeth II will still be referred to as a prince and is expected to continue living in his Windsor mansion.

title.children: The week started badly for Prince Andrew. Here's how it led to giving up his title
